newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Harmony, Freegold seen in Saaiplaas 3 deal.
newsitem.headline: Harmony, Freegold seen in Saaiplaas 3 deal.

text.p: South Africa's Harmony Gold Mining Co Ltd is expected to seal a deal with Free State Consolidated Gold Mines Ltd (Freegold) on the sale of Freegold's Saaiplaas No.3 shaft, analysts said on Thursday.
Earlier Anglo American Corp of South Africa Ltd, controller of Freegold, said it would hold a news conference with the other two firms at 1400 GMT on Thursday.
An Anglo spokeswoman declined to say what would be announced at the conference, but analysts said they expected a statement on a Saaiplaas deal.
"It must be Saaiplaas. I am not saying it is for sure, but I can't see what else it could be," one analyst said.
On January 13 Freegold and Harmony said they were in talks about the possible sale of the Saaiplaas No. 3 shaft and Harmony management would conduct a due diligence study.
The companies said workers at No.3 shaft would be re-employed at Freegold's Saaiplaas No.5 shaft and elsewhere in the Freegold group if the sale went ahead.

Analysts said a sale would suit both sides as Anglo is seeking to distance itself from its more marginal shafts, while Harmony -- with lower costs due to a wage structure orientated towards production bonuses -- would still be able to exploit the shaft.
